meanings.sent1: The children sang a cantic during the school assembly.
meanings.sent2: The cantic at the concert was so beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seem to have their own cantic going on.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a joyful cantic filling the room.
meanings.sent5: The cantic of the wind through the trees was calming.

meanings.definition: To sing or chant in a monotonous tone.
meanings.sent1: He would cantic the same tune every morning.
meanings.sent2: The monks would cantic their prayers in the temple.
meanings.sent3: The robot seemed to cantic its instructions repeatedly.
meanings.sent4: The rain continued to cantic on the roof all night.
meanings.sent5: Her voice seemed to cantic on and on, lulling me to sleep.
